description.narrative: Increased number people, in rural areas, small towns and urban centres as well as at schools and health centres have access to safe and affordable drinking water, especially women and girls.,which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Environmental Sustainability, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of people, especially girls and women, socially excluded groups and others in vulnerable situations, are healthy and live in resilient communities, access affordable and equitable WASH services and abandon open defecation

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased number people, in rural areas, small towns and urban centres as well as at schools and health centres have access to safe and affordable drinking water, especially women and girls.

description.narrative: In the current year, UNICEF provided 334,583 people with access to safe and affordable water supply including 16,022 school children and 15,600 patients. To date, 1,151,038 people including 61,276 school children (31,956 boys & 29,320 girls) and 136,520 patients visiting health facilities have been reached with durable water solutions. Collaboration and engagement of government ministries at federal and member state level continues to be strong and effective. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
